thread.title: ZTE Gets a Lifeline in Taiwanese Chip Supplier

author: Dan Strumpf
title: ZTE Gets a Lifeline in Taiwanese Chip Supplier

organizations.name: britain issue warnings over chinese telecom equipment maker zte
u.s. ban on selling to company pentagon orders stores on military bases

text:
HONG KONG—Taiwanese regulators authorized a key supplier of smartphone chips to resume sales to ZTE Corp., a boost for the Chinese telecommunications firm after its U.S. suppliers were barred from selling it parts.
The Taiwanese supplier, MediaTek Inc., won approval to resume exports of chips to ZTE, a MediaTek spokesman said Monday. The company supplies chipsets used in a number of ZTE smartphones, and while not a cure-all, analysts say a resumption of sales to ZTE restores an important part of ZTE’s supply chain.
